group.speak: Ah, hello. Welcome to the world of bits. A land filled with ones and zeros. My name, incase the interface hasn't told you already, is Professor Redwood. I'm known around these parts as The Bit Professor.
Now, my interface isn't working correctly, so it's not telling me your name. So, what is your name?

So your name is , then? I'll try to remember that. Now, it wouldn't be a proper introduction if I didn't ask "Are you a boy or a girl?", but I don't particularly care, so let's just pretend I asked that and move on.
You're going on a Fetch Quest. We're just making sure a thing works, so don't expect a lot of story. Your goal is to get the Giant Ruby. You'll start with nothing but your wits. Good Luck.
You materialze inside a natural park. You hear the sounds of a rushing river. You look around, and immediately catch the eye of another person.
Yeah, I see you eyeing my ruby. I found it, and it's going to feed me today. There aren't many days where I find somehting I can sell for food you know.
Have you heard of the saying "If you give a man a fish, you'll feed him for a day. If you teach a man -
yeahyeahyeah. I know how to fish, I don't have a fishing rod. I even know how to make one on the cheap - a lure, a rod, and some string. I don't know where to find those either.
If I find those three things for you, will you trade it for the ruby?
You know what? Sure. Find a lure, a rod, and some string and you can have the ruby.
